The Adventure Zone: Petals to the Metal The Adventure Zone: The Crystal Kingdom The Adventure Zone: The Eleventh Hour Read them all! Book 1 Book 2 Book 3 Book 4 Book 5

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A hilarious fantasy romp

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best Balance chapter yet.
reviews.reviewText: When I first heard that the podcast was being turned into a comic book, this was the act I was looking forward to most. (The Stolen Century is my other favorite, but that’s a couple years away.) I’m happy to report that seeing the battle race on paper was just as awesome as what I pictured in my head. What I didn’t expect was how well done the Hurley and Sloane relationship was presented. TAZ story has tugged on heartstrings in the past, but their story resonated more than the rest. When you add in Merle and the Director’s conversation about the human spirit, the especially sharp comedy, and all of the race and tower action, this is a chapter that is... wait for it... firing on all cylinders. Worth the wait, right?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Huge fan of the podcast. Listening to this group play gave me so much joy. And now to see it in full color and beautifully illustrated makes it so much more fun. I already own the other 2 volumes and can't wait to have the entire collection as they come out. If your a fan of the show and don't already have this you should own it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent adventure story
reviews.reviewText: As a fan of the Adventure Zone Podcast, I was excited to see this story put into comic form. The artists and writers have really gotten into the vibe and feeling that is so prevalent in the podcast, while still letting the visual medium shine.If you have not listened to the podcast, or don't have time to, as it is long, this is a fantastic way to experience the silly and amazing adventures that the McElroy's go through, in a much more compact medium. I HIGHLY recommend this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The campaign really starts to become the campaign we know and love
reviews.reviewText: PTTM, in my opinion, is really when Griffin realizes where he wants to go with the whole campaign. It really begins to come together. The artistry is amazing, and Carey continues to knock it out of the park with her illustrations.The dialogue- perfect, hilarious, and as always (especially when you’ve listened to the entire campaign) a little heart wrenching.I wouldn’t say PTTM is my fave, but I still absolutely LOVE it.Bravo to the McElBoys and Carey for being an amazing team and bringing this to paper!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great addition to a really amazing series
reviews.reviewText: If you're reading this review still wondering what the hype is about- just buy it! You won't be dissapointed. Petals to the Metal is vol 3 of "Adventure Zone" and follows the same named podcast in graphic form. This is a great addition to American comics- funny when it needs to be, and page turnint kick-ass aventure. All encompassing and lgbt friendly literature, this high fantasy will make you think.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Another stunning addition to the TAZ:B series; I am continually blown away by the story telling and artistry of these amazing books. The pacing hits that perfect sweet spot between serious and stupid funny, the composition and detail of the art is genuinely breathtaking, and it really feels like home to me when I read it and remember all my favorite characters and parts from the podcast. Really incredibly masterful job, I loved it <3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Same book, less money...
reviews.reviewText: Thisnis the 3rd book of a 3 book series, at least thats what i was told at a book store. I bought this for my daughter. It's the exact same book for much less money than the major book store we went to had it priced at. She loves that it is in comic book style on the inside but the outside looks like a regular children's book

reviews.reviewTitle: amazing comic but why greasy prints?
reviews.reviewText: The comics is amazing and that i already knew but it arrived with the cover covered in greasy fingerprints and the back with what seems to be food stain??? i cleaned it and everything is ok now but that really seems very unhygienic, especially in a time when attention to health and safety should be at its highest???i have yet to read it properly and I hope it doesn't have any other stains inside or im returning it asap

Because of some issues on my end, I didn't get the book on the 14th. I got it this afternoon and just finished reading it.Absolutely gorgeous. Did a really good job condensing the original material without losing anything, with plenty of references for people who have listened to the podcast without expecting anyone to have listened to it. There's good foreshadowing for what is to come. Illustrations are absolutely amazing, and flow really well. The visuals match the story in a really good way.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great adventure with amazing art
reviews.reviewText: I really loved this graphic novel comic, The Adventure Zone is my favorite RPG-style story and the artist brings that world alive beautifully with her art. Its really worth it <3Even if Petals to the Metal wasnt my favorite arc originally, this comic made it amazing, enticing and eletrifying! Cant wait for the next!!!
Well paced, a lot of fun and still very emotional. Couldn't stop reading from start to finish.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 7, 2020
reviews.reviewText: The Adventure Zone: Petals to the Metal is the latest and greatest instalment in the graphic novel adaptation of the superb podcast The Adventure Zone. Our heroes Merle, Taako and Magnus are thrust into the cutthroat world of battlewagon racing in order to retrieve another mysterious artifact. There's action, comedy, love and even an inspiring speech that gave me goosebumps.Podcast fans willbe delighted to see some of their favourite characters for the first time includingCaptain Captain Bane and Garyl the spectral binicorn and once again Carey Pietsch does an amazing job bringing these characters to life. The artwork is superb throughout and well worth the price of admission on its own.The whole thing is fantastic but the Hurley and Sloane arc was presented better here than even in the podcast and really made the heart of everything TAZ shine through.Bonus points for again including a section at the back of the book to showcase some of the amazing fan art developed by the TAZ community. There really are some wickedly talented folks out there.
